intro: Behuria mourae, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often cultivated for its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
